content: wannabe vintage mitts what you ll need gauge 32 sts and 44 row = 10 cm x 10 cm / 4 inch x 4 inch yarn in stockinette stitch laid flat and without stretching approximately 40g or about 150 m / 160 yards of sock weight yarn the mitts are designed to be worn with some negative ease the photos show the pattern in dream in color smooshy with 411 m / 450 yards per 113g skein sizing needles 1 set of dpns size 2 5 mm / us 1 5 or needle size to the pattern will work for small to medium sized obtain gauge womens hands i originally developed the mitts for hands with a circumference of 18 5 cm / 7 3 inches at notions the widest point around the knuckles 2 stitch markers if you want to make the mitts larger i suggest trying 1 stitch holder or waste yarn to knit at a larger gauge by using a larger needle 1 tapestry needle size optional 1 cable needle © jennifer büttgen 2014 v1 1 − 1 − for personal use only pattern instructions follow the instructions below twice once for the left and once for the right mitt where the pattern for left and right mitt differs instructions are described separately highlighted by l for left mitt and r for right mitt each the cuff row 1 9 loosely cast on 48 sts and divide the sts evenly on four dpns 12 sts per needle join in the round and work chart cuff a note the beginning of a row will always be in the thumb gusset center of the palm repeat the following section of 4 row five times * body setup l k6 sm m1l knit to 2nd marker m1r sm k5 knit one row of body chart k14 row 10 *k6 m1r* repeat this till end of row r k14 knit one row of body chart k5 sm m1l knit to 2nd marker m1r sm k6 row 11 k14 knit row 11 of body chart k14 l+r knit three row in pattern *  you should now have 56 sts on your needles 14 sts per needle note while developing the thumb gusset you will repeat the cable pattern about 1 5 times ending lower body with row 19 of the body chart row 12 27  you now have 62 sts on your needles with 15 sts starting from row 12 of body chart in between the two stitch markers *k14 knit one row of body chart k14* knit the next row in pattern till the first marker then repeat this until you reach row 27 of the body chart place the 15 sts between markers on a stitch holder i e after one complete pattern repeat or waste yarn cast on 3 sts on your working needle and knit till the end of the row in pattern thumb gusset setup  you now have 56 sts on your needles 14
